Shadowheart_WyrmSouth.synopsis: Jaheira/Shadowheart Party Banter at Wyrm's Crossing South

Astarion_NorthAlleys_3.speaker: Jaheira
Astarion_NorthAlleys_3.text: Never mind the shining squares - I am more comfortable on streets such as this. A peek at the true face behind the mask.

Astarion_NorthAlleys_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_NorthAlleys_0.text: Yet another thing we have in common. We're two peas in a pod.

Astarion_NorthAlleys_1.speaker: Jaheira
Astarion_NorthAlleys_1.text: I said a peek behind the city's mask, Astarion - not a look up its skirts.

Astarion_NorthAlleys_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_NorthAlleys_2.text: Jaheira! What do you think of me?

Minsc_Guildhall_2.speaker: Jaheira
Minsc_Guildhall_2.text: If Nine-Fingers survived the fray, she will be right back to work in there. We ought to speak to her.

Minsc_Guildhall_0.speaker: Minsc
Minsc_Guildhall_0.text: She has you in her thrall, Jaheira. Minsc will still her serpent tongue, before it has a chance to twine around your thoughts!

Minsc_Guildhall_1.speaker: Jaheira
Minsc_Guildhall_1.text: That, she will definitely have something to say about.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Jaheira
Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.text: Archdruid. You appear to gather a rather fanatic following wherever you go. A noble thing, to serve nature so tirelessly.
Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.context: NodeContext: Amused, kinda being a little bit nosy in reference to the many romances Halsin can strike up throughout the game.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.text: I welcome all of nature's blessings, whether they come to me one at a time, or in multitudes. There is no shame in it.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Jaheira
Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.text: Consider me put in my place. Clearly, I have been spending too much time among the city-folk.
Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.context: NodeContext: Backing off, conceding the point - she overstepped a little

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.speaker: Jaheira
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.text: You consumed all the spawn in your service, lord Astarion. You shall have to fend for yourself a while.
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.context: NodeContext: Smiling, but not much humour in it

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_3.text: Oh, I've never had trouble attracting foolish, pretty people.

Gale_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Jaheira
Gale_ROM_Act3_0.text: So you wish to be a god, Gale? You know the wizard Irenicus attempted the same thing, by leeching divine blood from a Bhaalspawn.
Gale_ROM_Act3_0.context: NodeContext: Curiousity, but slight edge to it - she hated Irenicus and his ambition, and is sounding Gale out.

Gale_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_1.text: Aha, transfusion! An interesting strategy. Hard to get hold of a god's blood, of course, but if one could...

Gale_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Jaheira
Gale_ROM_Act3_3.text: He managed it. After murdering my husband, and torturing my friends and I for half a year.
Gale_ROM_Act3_3.context: NodeContext: Deadpan. Not playing for sympathy - more a dry warning about what it takes.

Gale_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_2.text: Did I say interesting? I meant terrible, of course. A terrible strategy...
Gale_ROM_Act3_2.context: NodeContext: Knows he put his foot in it, backpedalling fast

Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_2.speaker: Jaheira
Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_2.text: Wyrm's Crossing. This place has been a haven, when Harpers were less than welcome in the city proper.

Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_0.text: It is always wise to have another redoubt, another escape route. Though I assumed your lot's antics would have secured you the love of the masses.
Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_0.context: NodeContext: 'Seems hard to imagine ' = SH has turned from Shar. 'Always wise to have another redoubt' = SH is loyal to shar

Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_1.speaker: Jaheira
Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_1.text: Oh, a Harper does not go in for public acclaim. We work in shadow and secrecy, tragically unacknowledged by the ungrateful herd.
Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_1.context: NodeContext: Heavy sarcasm, but fond - the Harpers have a reputation for being do-gooders, but smug about it. She agress with both assessments - one doesn't override the others.

Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_3.context: NodeContext: Wry. Arc: SH has turned from Shar. Perhaps noting the similarities between Harper and Sharran tradecraft here.

Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_4.text: Lady Shar's children toil similarly... but we know there is no need to seek the favour of others. Our lady's love is all we need.
Shadowheart_WyrmSouth_4.context: NodeContext: A little pious Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_1.speaker: Jaheira
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_1.text: I am glad it is your non-vampiric charms our friend has fallen for, Astarion. It is, isn't it?
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_1.context: NodeContext: Mocking, but not overly cruelly. Exchange should work as edged playfulness between companions

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_4.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_4.text: Of course! Is it so unbelievable that they would simply like me?

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_3.text: If you insist on prying, perhaps you'd care to join us and see how much we enjoy one another?

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_2.speaker: Jaheira
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_2.text: Why? Do you require some instruction on how the deed is done?
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_2.context: NodeContext: Not cutting - just smirking, refusing to be scandalised

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_0.text: I'm sure even I could learn some new tricks from an old veteran such as yourself.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Jaheira
Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.text: You've a love-struck look about you, Karlach. Just do not let it distract you from the task ahead.
Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.context: NodeContext: A little stern (putting on an act, being intentionally nosy, trying to provoke irritation)

Karlach_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_2.text: But what if I really enjoy being distracted from the task ahead?

Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Jaheira
Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.text: Bah, where is the barbarian rage? I have been learning so many colourful phrases from you, I was hoping to inspire a few more.
Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.context: NodeContext: Dropping the act, mock disappointment.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.text: Ma'am, you've been inspiring me since I was yea high.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Jaheira
Wyll_ROM_Act3_0.text: So, Wyll - you have your mind set on marriage.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_3.text: Why not? If this adventure has taught me anything, it's that life is fragile, and we should seize joy when we can. You think I'm being rash?

Wyll_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Jaheira
Wyll_ROM_Act3_1.text: Not at all. The world does not wait around for us, so take your moment while you may. Damn what anyone else thinks.
Wyll_ROM_Act3_1.context: NodeContext: Au contraire, she's not judging

Wyll_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Jaheira
Wyll_ROM_Act3_2.text: So long as you serve a proper meal at the wedding. None of this finger-picking nonsense, yes?
Wyll_ROM_Act3_2.context: NodeContext: Damn what anyone else thinks EXCEPT her on this SPECIFIC matter

Laezel_Docks_2.speaker: Jaheira
Laezel_Docks_2.text: Ugh. I have no love for the sea, but the city would not be what it is without these ships. That lends them a kind of beauty, I suppose.

Laezel_Docks_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Docks_0.text: Indeed. There is no more impressive sight than a githyanki spelljammer with its astral sails unfurled.

Laezel_Docks_1.speaker: Jaheira
Laezel_Docks_1.text: A sweeter sight still, the world those ships might make if you plied them between the planes. Interplanar learning, trade...

Laezel_Docks_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Docks_3.text: Trade? Why stoop to barter when you have the power to take what you need?

Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Jaheira
Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.text: Lae'zel. My brief time on the Astral Plane left quite the impression. You must miss it dearly.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.text: I don't hail from the Astral, Jaheira. My glimpse was as brief as yours, before we were cast back to the Material.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.text: If only I might have remained there. Oh, to soar the skies above Tu'narath atop a red dragon...

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_0.speaker: Jaheira
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_0.text: Tell me, Shadowheart - how does Shar's favour feel? Does it fill you up, bring you joy?

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_2.text: A nice vintage or a comfortable bed bring me joy. This is much more than that. This brings me purpose.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_2.context: NodeContext: Confident. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_1.speaker: Jaheira
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_1.text: So humbly spoken. Perhaps you are a different breed than the last Mother Superior.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_3.text: Time shall tell. At the very least, I can learn from her mistakes.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_3.context: NodeContext: Confident. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_2.speaker: Jaheira
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_2.text: And now another 'final' battle. This small band has gone further than any army could have in its place.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_0.text: You didn't seek to gather the Harpers for one last charge? Fodder for heroic ballads yet to be written, perhaps.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_3.speaker: Jaheira
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_3.text: Not at all - Harpers fight dirty. A well-timed strike, with the knowledge of just where to place it, and suddenly superior numbers count for nothing.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_1.text: You must have been following the example of Lady Shar's children then - they do say imitation is a form of flattery.
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_1.context: NodeContext: 'hopefully that's where the similiarities end' = Sh has turned from Shar. 'imitation is a form of flattery' = SH is loyal to shar. A little smug on the latter.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.speaker: Jaheira
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.text: Shadowheart. You should know - Viconia was not half so heartless as she liked to appear.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.context: NodeContext: Had been mulling this, now broaching it.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_3.text: I knew her well enough. You might have travelled with her for a time, but she trained me. What's your point?
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_3.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced Arc: SH abandoned Shar

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.speaker: Jaheira
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.text: Only that I find it hard to believe that she could have raised you, and felt nothing for you.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.context: NodeContext: Not overly soft - she knew what Viconia was - but offering up comfort she thinks SH might need (rightly or wrongly)

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_4.text: Perhaps she took some pride in her work, forming me to Shar's liking. She certainly relished wielding the rod..
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_4.context: NodeContext: Some lingering bitterness. Arc: SH abandoned Shar

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.text: ... but who knows. Perhaps someone else made her that way, as she tried to do to me.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.context: NodeContext: A little thoughtful. Arc: SH abandoned Shar
